availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
TO THE SHERIFF OF McCRACKEN COUNTY: Greeting

We command you that of the estate of Wm Boyd & P D Yeiser you cause to be made the sum of Two hundred dollars dollars, which The Commonwealth of Kentucky late in our McCrackenLyon Circuit Court hath recovered against them for debt on a forfeited reconizance with interest thereon from the 28 day of June 1862 until paid.

Also the sum of $ 2two dollars ^& fifty^ cents, which toin the said in the same Court werewas adjudged ^to the ^said^ Commonwealth^ for his costs in that suit expended, whereof the Said defendants are convicted, as appears to us of record, and that you have the said sums of money before our said Court on the 20th day of October next1862, to render to the said Commonwealth her the debt, interest and cost aforesaid, and have then and there this writ.
WITNESS, B. SMALL, A H Dudley, Clerk of said Court, this 12th day of September 1862
Come to hand at 10 OClock A M Sept 20th 1862
G B Grundy S M C
The within is a true copy of the original fifa in which has been placed in my hands for Collection as Sheriff in favor of the Commonwealth of Ky vs Wm Boyd & P D Yeiser This Oct 4th 1862
G B Grundy S M C

Commonwealth
vs } fifa
Boyd & Yeiser
20 Oct 1862
